text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God, for the sake of the promise of life that is in Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To Timothy, my beloved child:
Grace, mercy, and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am grateful to God—whom I worship with a clear conscience, as my ancestors did—when I remember you constantly in my prayers night and day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Recalling your tears, I long to see you so that I may be filled with joy.
speaker: Narrator

text: I am reminded of your sincere faith, a faith that lived first in your grandmother Lois and your mother Eunice and now, I am sure, lives in you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this reason I remind you to rekindle the gift of God that is within you through the laying on of my hands,
speaker: Narrator

text: for God did not give us a spirit of cowardice but rather a spirit of power and of love and of self-discipline.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not be ashamed, then, of the testimony about our Lord or of me his prisoner, but join with me in suffering for the gospel, in the power of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: who saved us and called us with a holy calling, not according to our works but according to his own purpose and grace, and this grace was given to us in Christ Jesus before the ages began,
speaker: Narrator

text: but it has now been revealed through the appearing of our Savior Jesus Christ, who abolished death and brought life and immortality to light through the gospel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this gospel I was appointed a herald and an apostle and a teacher,
speaker: Narrator

text: and for this reason I suffer as I do. But I am not ashamed, for I know the one in whom I have put my trust, and I am sure that he is able to guard until that day the deposit I have entrusted to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hold to the standard of sound teaching that you have heard from me, in the faith and love that are in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Guard the good deposit entrusted to you, with the help of the Holy Spirit living in us.
speaker: Narrator

text: You are aware that all who are in Asia have turned away from me, including Phygelus and Hermogenes.
speaker: Narrator

text: May the Lord grant mercy to the household of Onesiphorus, because he often refreshed me and was not ashamed of my chain;
speaker: Narrator

text: when he arrived in Rome, he eagerly searched for me and found me
speaker: Narrator

text: —may the Lord grant that he will find mercy from the Lord on that day! And you know very well how much service he rendered in Ephesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: You then, my child, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus,
speaker: Narrator

text: and what you have heard from me through many witnesses entrust to faithful people who will be able to teach others as well.
speaker: Narrator

text: Share in suffering like a good soldier of Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one serving in the army gets entangled in everyday affairs; the soldier’s aim is to please the enlisting officer.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the case of an athlete, no one is crowned without competing according to the rules.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is the farmer who does the work who ought to have the first share of the crops.
speaker: Narrator

text: Think over what I say, for the Lord will give you understanding in all things.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember Jesus Christ, raised from the dead, a descendant of David—that is my gospel,
speaker: Narrator

text: for which I suffer hardship, even to the point of being chained like a criminal. But the word of God is not chained.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore I endure everything for the sake of the elect, so that they may also obtain the salvation that is in Christ Jesus, with eternal glory.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The saying is sure:
If we have died with him, we will also live with him;
speaker: Narrator

text:
if we endure, we will also reign with him;
if we deny him, he will also deny us;
speaker: Narrator

text:
if we are faithless, he remains faithful—
he cannot deny himself.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remind them of this, and warn them before the Lord that they are to avoid wrangling over words, which does no good but only ruins those who are listening.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do your best to present yourself to God as one approved by him, a worker who has no need to be ashamed, rightly explaining the word of truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Avoid profane chatter, for it will lead people into more and more impiety,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their talk will spread like gangrene. Among them are Hymenaeus and Philetus,
speaker: Narrator

text: who have swerved from the truth, saying resurrection has already occurred. They are upsetting the faith of some.
speaker: Narrator

text: But God’s firm foundation stands, bearing this inscription: “The Lord knows those who are his,” and, “Let everyone who calls on the name of the Lord turn away from wickedness.”
speaker: Narrator

text: In a large house there are utensils not only of gold and silver but also of wood and clay, some for special use, some for ordinary.
speaker: Narrator

text: All who cleanse themselves of the things I have mentioned will become special utensils, dedicated and useful to the owner of the house, ready for every good work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Shun youthful passions and pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace, along with those who call on the Lord from a pure heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have nothing to do with stupid and senseless controversies; you know that they breed quarrels.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord’s servant must not be quarrelsome but kindly to everyone, an apt teacher, patient,
speaker: Narrator

text: correcting opponents with gentleness. God may perhaps grant that they will repent and come to know the truth
speaker: Narrator

text: and that they may escape from the snare of the devil, having been held captive by him to do his will.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must understand this, that in the last days distressing times will come.
speaker: Narrator

text: For people will be lovers of themselves, lovers of money, boasters, arrogant, abusive, disobedient to their parents, ungrateful, unholy,
speaker: Narrator

text: unfeeling, implacable, slanderers, profligates, brutes, haters of good,
speaker: Narrator

text: treacherous, reckless, swollen with conceit, lovers of pleasure rather than lovers of God,
speaker: Narrator

text: holding to the outward form of godliness but denying its power. Avoid them!
speaker: Narrator

text: For among them are those who make their way into households and captivate immature women, overwhelmed by their sins and swayed by all kinds of desires,
speaker: Narrator

text: who are always studying yet never able to recognize truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: As Jannes and Jambres opposed Moses, so these people, of corrupt mind and counterfeit faith, also oppose the truth.
speaker: Narrator

text: But they will not make much progress because, as in the case of those two men, their folly will become plain to everyone.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now you have observed my teaching, my conduct, my aim in life, my faith, my patience, my love, my steadfastness,
speaker: Narrator

text: my persecutions, and my sufferings, the things that happened to me in Antioch, Iconium, and Lystra. What persecutions I endured! Yet the Lord rescued me from all of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Indeed, all who want to live a godly life in Christ Jesus will be persecuted.
speaker: Narrator

text: But wicked people and impostors will go from bad to worse, deceiving others and being deceived.
speaker: Narrator

text: But as for you, continue in what you have learned and firmly believed, knowing from whom you learned it
speaker: Narrator

text: and how from childhood you have known sacred writings that are able to instruct you for salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: All scripture is inspired by God and is useful for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for training in righteousness,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that the person of God may be proficient, equipped for every good work.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the presence of God and of Christ Jesus, who is to judge the living and the dead, and in view of his appearing and his kingdom, I solemnly urge you:
speaker: Narrator

text: proclaim the message; be persistent whether the time is favorable or unfavorable; convince, rebuke, and encourage with the utmost patience in teaching.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the time is coming when people will not put up with sound teaching, but, having their ears tickled, they will accumulate for themselves teachers to suit their own desires
speaker: Narrator

text: and will turn away from listening to the truth and wander away to myths.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for you, be sober in everything, endure suffering, do the work of an evangelist, carry out your ministry fully.
speaker: Narrator

text: As for me, I am already being poured out as a libation, and the time of my departure has come.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have fought the good fight; I have finished the race; I have kept the faith.
speaker: Narrator

text: From now on there is reserved for me the crown of righteousness, which the Lord, the righteous judge, will give me on that day, and not only to me but also to all who have longed for his appearing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do your best to come to me soon,
speaker: Narrator

text: for Demas, in love with this present world, has deserted me and gone to Thessalonica; Crescens has gone to Galatia, Titus to Dalmatia.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only Luke is with me. Get Mark and bring him with you, for he is useful to me in ministry.
speaker: Narrator

text: I have sent Tychicus to Ephesus.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you come, bring the cloak that I left with Carpus at Troas, also the books, and above all the parchments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Alexander the coppersmith did me great harm; the Lord will pay him back for his deeds.
speaker: Narrator

text: You also must beware of him, for he strongly opposed our message.
speaker: Narrator

text: At my first defense no one came to my support, but all deserted me. May it not be counted against them!
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord stood by me and gave me strength, so that through me the message might be fully proclaimed and all the gentiles might hear it. So I was rescued from the lion’s mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord will rescue me from every evil attack and save me for his heavenly kingdom. To him be the glory forever and ever. Amen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Greet Prisca and Aquila and the household of Onesiphorus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Erastus remained in Corinth; Trophimus I left ill in Miletus.
speaker: Narrator

text: Do your best to come before winter. Eubulus sends greetings to you, as do Pudens and Linus and Claudia and all the brothers and sisters.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord be with your spirit. Grace be with you.
speaker: Narrator
